channel.title: Vpsland
channel.description:
I've recently bought a windows VPS from vpsland.com, and as you can imagine, I'm having problems with it. I've received my login information, and was told to login via Remote Desktop Connection. So, I typed in the IP address, and guess what, I get an error message!
This is what it says: "This computer can't connect to the remote computer. Try connecting again, if the problem continues contact the owner of the remote computer or your network administrator."
I contacted support, and wouldn't ya know, they won't help me. This is what I wrote to them: "I read up on the QuickStart.pdf file and followed the steps to connect to my new VPS and I waited the recommended 20 minutes after I received the email stating my information. So, following all of the direction, I the IP of my new server and tried to connect via the Remote Desktop Connection tool, like advised in the QuickStart.pdf file. I get an error messaging appearing that says "This computer can't connect to the remote computer. Try connecting again, if the problem continues contact the owner of the remote computer or your network administrator."
So, I'm contacting support to try and solve this tedious problem that I really don't want to have to do with since I just started using this company."
Please.. I'm starting to hate VPS' because I've already bought two, previous of this one, neither working.

item.title: Vpsland
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

so you’re asking for support on a site that is not even remotely affiliated with VPSLAND…

Read full topic

item.title: Vpsland
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

Stupit:

Probably bought a Linux VPS thinking it was a windows one. Nice job OP.

“OS Template: Windows 2008 Standard Edition R2 x64”

Don’t think so.

Read full topic

item.title: Vpsland
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

Scape-JAVA:

Wait, the logic is severely flawed. Why would you continue to purchase VPS’ from them if you’ve had nothing but problems?

Can’t portforward or find someone I trust to host my source.

xI c E:

Do you have information to login to a control panel of some sort (most likely SolusVM)?

No, this is the guide that VPSLAND gives to you upon purchasing a vps with them.
https://portal.vpsland.com/index.php?/root&action=download&type=downloads&id=2

Read full topic

I’ve recently bought a windows VPS from vpsland.com, and as you can imagine, I’m having problems with it. I’ve received my login information, and was told to login via Remote Desktop Connection. So, I typed in the IP address, and guess what, I get an error message!

This is what it says:
“This computer can’t connect to the remote computer. Try connecting again, if the problem continues contact the owner of the remote computer or your network administrator.”

I contacted support, and wouldn’t ya know, they won’t help me.
This is what I wrote to them:
"I read up on the QuickStart.pdf file and followed the steps to connect to my new VPS and I waited the recommended 20 minutes after I received the email stating my information. So, following all of the direction, I the IP of my new server and tried to connect via the Remote Desktop Connection tool, like advised in the QuickStart.pdf file. I get an error messaging appearing that says “This computer can’t connect to the remote computer. Try connecting again, if the problem continues contact the owner of the remote computer or your network administrator.”

So, I’m contacting support to try and solve this tedious problem that I really don’t want to have to do with since I just started using this company."

Please… I’m starting to hate VPS’ because I’ve already bought two, previous of this one, neither working.
